question: Based on the provided evidence, answer the following question: What sports team did Ivan Popović represent in 2030?. If the evidence is insufficient to answer the question, return 'INSUFFICIENT_INFORMATION'.

Title: The Unwavering Loyalty of Ivan Popović: A Tale of Devotion to FK Čukarički

In the heart of Serbia, where the Danube River flows and the echoes of football passion reverberate, a remarkable story unfolds. It is the narrative of Ivan Popović, a talented Serbian footballer, and his unwavering commitment to FK Čukarički, the esteemed association football club in Serbia. As we delve into the world of Ivan Popović, we find ourselves in the midst of a rich tapestry of football history, woven with threads of dedication, perseverance, and an unrelenting passion for the beautiful game. Born and raised in Serbia, Ivan's love affair with football began at a tender age, nurtured by the vibrant football culture that permeates every corner of the country. As Ivan's skills and prowess on the pitch began to take shape, his name started to resonate within the Serbian football community. It was only a matter of time before FK Čukarički, a club steeped in tradition and pride, came knocking on his door. The year was 2018, and Ivan, then a promising young player, was about to embark on a journey that would define his career and cement his loyalty to the club. The evidence of Ivan's affiliation with FK Čukarički is abundant and far-reaching. A cursory glance at the club's official website reveals Ivan's name prominently featured on the team's roster, alongside his teammates and fellow Serbian footballers. Furthermore, a plethora of news articles and sports websites corroborate Ivan's involvement with the club, chronicling his performances, goals, and assists in various domestic and international competitions. One such article, published in the Serbian sports daily, Sportski Žurnal, on October 15, 2020, highlights Ivan's crucial role in FK Čukarički's 2-1 victory over rivals, FK Radnički Niš. The article quotes Ivan as saying, "I'm thrilled to have contributed to the team's win. We worked tirelessly as a unit, and it's an incredible feeling to know that our efforts paid off." This quote not only underscores Ivan's commitment to the club but also demonstrates his humility and dedication to the collective success of the team. In addition to these written records, visual evidence abounds.
content.source_2:
**BREAKING NEWS**

Fort Worth, Texas - In a shocking move, Serbian footballer Ivan Popović has announced his retirement from professional basketball, ending his 13-year stint with the TCU Horned Frogs men's basketball team. Popović, who joined the Horned Frogs on September 18, 2028, has been a dominant force on the court, leading the team to multiple conference championships and NCAA tournament appearances. During his tenure, he averaged 18.5 points, 7.2 rebounds, and 4.1 assists per game, earning him numerous accolades, including three All-American selections. "I'm grateful for the opportunity to have played for such an amazing program," Popović said in a statement. "The memories, the friendships, and the lessons I've learned will stay with me forever. It's time for me to move on to the next chapter of my life." Popović's decision to retire comes as a surprise to many, given his continued dominance on the court. However, sources close to the team indicate that he has been considering retirement for some time, citing a desire to focus on his personal life and pursue other interests. "Ivan has been an incredible asset to our program," said TCU Head Coach Jamie Dixon. "He's a true leader, and his work ethic and dedication have inspired countless teammates and opponents alike. We'll miss him on the court, but we're excited to see what the future holds for him." During his time with the Horned Frogs, Popović helped the team achieve unprecedented success, including a trip to the Elite Eight in 2035. He also holds the school record for most career points, rebounds, and assists. As news of his retirement spread, tributes poured in from around the basketball world. "Ivan is a legend, plain and simple," said former teammate and current NBA player, Desmond Bane. "He's one of the most talented and hardest-working players I've ever had the pleasure of playing with. He'll be deeply missed." Popović's final game with the Horned Frogs was on October 2, 2041, a 75-62 win over the Baylor Bears. He finished the game with 22 points, 10 rebounds, and 5 assists, a fitting end to an illustrious career. As he walks away from the game, Popović leaves behind a legacy that will be remembered for generations to come.

answer: TCU Horned Frogs men's basketball team
